column5: Flying in June 10.. Should I go ahead and buy license for fishing trip?
Doesn't matter when you buy your license. You can buy it online, enter the dates for your fishing trip, and then print it out. Your fishing trip is valid for the dates you submitted. PjShorthorn

No reason not to, saves messing with it on the trip. That is assuming you can for whichever province your headed to. I've had my Manitoba license for a month or so, they let you buy before the season opens now but you used to have to wait until whenever the season opened towards the end of April. Not sure what other provinces do as far as that goes.
No advantage to doing it now - in case something happens and your plans change. Get it a few days before you leave. Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
This is always my theory too. 👍🏻

It is very easy to get it online.. And if you need to update your Ontario Outdoor Card (Peche), it will be delivered to you with your privileges printed out on the card.. Kinda nice.. Took about one week to receive it in the mail.
I make a couple of trips a year to NW Ontario, so I buy the three year license online.
Agree 100 percent. you can have both a digital and paper copy in case you have problems with either one
